reviews.review_msg: Jerry is inspirational.  He's just an awesome prof.  Had him for EDUC 100, took it as an easy credit, and I thought the class was a cinch.  Ease aside though, take it for Jerry alone.  When he did not have me laughing (he's got a very comedic manner of teaching) he was provoking me to really THINK.  Few profs out there do this.  Highly recommended.
highly highly HIGHLY recommend this course. he was my favourite prof, I think every class at university should be like his classes. never boring,and always has a great answer to your questions

Extremely tough on her students. Not lenient about things even during covid where we are all stressed about remote learning. Tough marking and won't give students deadline extensions or exceptions even if they had a valid reason. This is supposed to be an easy entry-level education course and she made it extremely hard. Would not recommend it.

Michael is absolutely AMAZING! He's very easy to talk to, and encourages the class to get to know one another on a more personal level. Very inspirational and open minded. Classes are engaging and fun to be in. Makes you really think about education and how it applies to everyday life. I'm considering changing majors because of him. Life changing.

He is very boring. Not that interested in his students. Consistently late, his phone even rang during a group presentation. Really easy class. Very easy to get an A+ if you are a good writer and need a slightly less challenging course.
One of the best professors I have ever had at SFU. Enjoy having class with her.
Michele is definitely one of the best professors at SFU. She is well respected and cares about her students. Would definitely take more classes with her!

Best prof at SFU. Cares about her students, very approachable and helps them get the best grade possible. Very little workload and no final or midterm. She is very flexible with due dates and gives lots of time to complete assignments. Hands down the easiest course at SFU.

This is my third year at SFU and I can honestly say this is the first professor I have ever had who genuinely cared for her students. She is a very down to earth humble professor that is always approachable. I would definitely recommend taking EDUC100 with her and nobody else.
Michele is an amazing prof. She made Education 100 a pleasant experience and found creative ways for us to demonstrate our learning. She's very approachable and is flexible with due dates.

Paula is a wonderful professor, if you have the opportunity to take a course with her do not pass it up. She gives amazing feedback and I feel that my writing has become stronger by being in her class. EDUC 100 has a good mix of group and individual projects and collaborating is encouraged. I would definitely take another class with Paula!

My experience in taking this EDUC course has been eye-opening. The lectures are inspirational, and really teach you how to self-reflect which is an important tool for teaching. She makes learning less of a chore and more of a hobby if that makes sense. Take her class if you want to improve on your writing skills, she gives amazing feedback :D

The best prof ever. Hands down. An inspirational class - take EDUC 100 with Paula if you get the chance to. She makes learning fun, and the work we have to do for the class does not feel like work. Paula is kind, understanding, motivating, well- respected, and she genuinely cares for each of her students. Thank you Paula :)
The coolest prof ever,

She's one of the sweetest people you will ever meet. Her stories can go on for the entire class, but it doesn't even matter, because they are so entertaining. Educ 100 is definitely a GPA booster and I haven't said that about any class before. Strangely, my writing skills drastically improved after the final paper because of her editing. Wonderful!
Unclear grading criteria, spends way too long talking about useless things, but I guess the assignments are easy
didn't even get a good mark. too much for for an easy class

Meguido Zola is one of the most inspiring people i've ever met. He is helpful, kind, supportive, and is interested in you as a person rather than seeing you as a student number. He is an amazing prof. TAKE HIS COURSE!!!!
He is amazing!
He was a good and fair prof. He helped those who needed it and didnt put up with any bull. Really makes you think outside the box!

Awesome prof, everyone hating on this guy clearly didn't do well in his class or is some book worm incapable of thinking outside of the box. It was a great class and I'd recommend it and the prof to anyone. A+++

Meguido is a very interesting character and can be both very kind and incredibly rude. He does choose favorites, but because the course work is so easy it really doesn't matter if you're one of them or not. easy GPA boost.
He's a great guy, his heart is in the right place, no I'm not hot looking. I enjoyed his humour.

Meguido is an incredibly wonderful professor. I come out of this class a happier and more confident person, hoping to become a teacher! Some may not get his sense of humor which can easily be mistaken as being rude but seriously, he's not from Canada, he finds sarcasm funny, deal with it! The books are wonderful and each class a joy to attend!
One of the best profs ever!!!

I found his course to be the most life changing course I've ever taken - and I've taken A LOT!His philosophy around making the students, rather than the prof., the center of learning was the first I'd ever encountered and now has become my own as a future teacher.Since that class, he has become my mentor and I've learned an INCREDIBLE amount.
The previous poster's lack of proper grammar and syntax may explain why she never picked up on Zola's belittling sarcasm.
It also helps if you are a pretty female!

I disagree with all the negative comments about this professor.  He is an extremely helpful professor and has inspired me to become the same kind of person and teacher, its not his fault that some students misread the instructions of assignments and can't comprehend an open-ended assignment!
I found that he really picks favorites.
I think he only liked certain people in the class, especially ppl who are expressive and extroverted.  I don't think he ever knew my name while it was just a 20 ppl lecture.

Meguido's class was interesting.  Definitly not how I pictured it.  We got to make our own journal to find our "true vocation."  I never found my true vocation, but had tons of fun making my journal.  Take his class if you want to learn differen
Total GPA booster...free ride and no pressure. Final is a group project..4 assignments, participation and attendance...easy "A"

meguido is a very interesting prof.  he has so many stories, and we talked about so many important issues in education.  the personal journal we were assigned was one of he best assignments i have ever done, although it was worth 50% of my grade.
No Comments
No Comments
Eccentric, offbeat, some find him rude and arrogant, others will learn a lot.
Embarassed me on the first day, simply for asking a question. Not helpful.
No Comments

gpa booster for sure. One thing to know is that he likes to engage everyone in the class and ask everyone questions, if you sit there with a blank stare and he knows you haven't been listening this reflects in his marking. wrote some killer essays and journals and ended up with crappy marks, not impressed mark, not impressed
My favorite prof this semester. He's easy going and very approachable. Some work involved, but you can get by fine w/o the readings. Classes are always interactive and memorable.
SUPER prof. Easy going, funny, bright, involves everyone in the class. There is quite a bit of work but its easy and fun and he marks very fairly. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this class!

While I thought this class would be boring, Mark really opened my eyes to the world of education and really challenged me to think about the issues. It is not a class for slackers as you really do have to think about the issues and make insightful comments, but for anyone interested in teaching, I would highly recommend taking this course with Mark
quite tricky
a nice guy but not a nice prof...made educ 100 the most boring course ever...
Mark is really  a very nice guy!!!
No Comments
greeeaaat looking man...cute cute accent...warm, friendly smile.. how inappropriate of me to be even thinking like this .. good teacher tho, nice attitude and easy going
Best prof i've ever had! If you can take a class with her, do it!
learn nothing from her, tons of assignments, MUST attend the class!  don't need to work too hard cos no matter what, you will get a "fair" mark = "B"

Marela is one of the nicest professors you will ever have at SFU. Her 3-hour seminars can seem to drag on as she will talk about nothing for a while, but she is so nice and caring. She really cares about her students and seems like such a real person.

Kari was FANTASTIC.  She has an absolute passion for education and it clearly shows!  She is willing to go above and beyond her duties as an educator, and she is willing to listen to various points of view. If you want to be an educator, taking this class will change your perspective on pedagogy, from both the student and teacher perspective!

Relatively easy and straightforward course. The course is composed 50/50 of short writing assignments and discussions which are due every week. The reading material is very accessible and simple, and the writing assignments and discussions are clearly laid out. I would recommend taking this course online, as I can't imagine in-person is as easy.
Very boring. Not the GPA boost it's mad up to be. Very long and tedious readings. No structure. Pass on this course and take it in class

Have heard AMAZING things about this prof and class HOWEVER the ONLINE/DISTANCE ED version of this class is HORRIBLE. This course was difficult and EXTREMELY time consuming. Look elsewhere for an elective or take it in-class

Allan is a wonderful prof, I cannot stress how great of a person he is. He's so chill and helpful and all of the assignments (paper/portfolio and a presentation) were so flexible; he lets you use your creativity. The other parts of the course were online discussions on canvas, so easy! Plus, no final! Take educ 100 with him!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE. It was a huge mistake. I took it online and my friend took it in-class both with Mackinnon and she loved him. But the online version was quite poorly done. Very difficult, unclear and no direction whereas in-class was the opposite. If you are going to take it online swap to something else... trust me
Great man to take upper division classes with but EDUC 100 was not as good as I expected. Material and text were hard to understand, assignments were long and boring, I would definetely not recommend
Best professor I've ever had at SFU... He'll go any length to help you, no matter what your problem is. Extremely down to Earth individual. Words cannot describe how great this man is.
A genuinely nice person who cares about the students in her class.  Class is marked fair and as a Prof she is very understanding.  Highly recommend taking this course so long as she is teaching it.
The best prof ever, she responds back to emails instantly and gives genuine good feedback!

One of the greatest profs I've ever had. She genuinely cares about every student and accommodates to their learning needs as best as she can. Consider yourself lucky if you ever get the chance to take a class with her!
Amazing prof I've ever had.
She is a great prof! She gives great feedback on the weekly reading responses and there is no final exam for the course only a final paper! Definitely would take another course with her.

This was one of my most favourite classes at SFU.  although he seemed spaced out at times, his thougths and ideas regarding education are VERY interesting and valid at every level. i learned 100 times more in this class then in any other class ive taken. definate gpa boost but its not about the gpa.. take the class its FUN!

best prof ive ever had at sfu. she works hard to make sure every student does well and fully understands whatever she's covering. definitely a life-changing course, and meg was what made it life changing.

Meg is a goddess!! She gets hotter and hotter everytime I come to class! I am disliking the course very much, but meg is an amazing teacher. I assignments require lots of thought and she gives you feedback. All of the writing is about yourself, your own life and your own life. She said in class "your writing for yourself, not for me." Sums it up.
I disliked this course but liked  Meg a lot. She was really warm and motherly, but the fluffiness of the class wasn't my thing.

She is the best prof ever. You actually learn sth in this class. It's not like other classes that you just memorise and forget everything after final. She is caring, patient, and knowledgable. She makes you change. She makes you know yourself better.
Best Professor I've ever had - she changed my life!!!

It's a really great class, she's very nice and she does care about her students. It's a morning class but the time goes by really fast and her assignments are not difficult but requires a lot of thought.

Most caring prof I've had yet! She actually listens to what the students have to say and the way the marks are broken down shows that she teaches for her students to learn for themselves as opposed to just writing and saying what the prof wants to hear.
she's hot! course is okay too
Meg is smokin' HOT and her class is amazing... I LOVE YOU MEG!!
Truly cares about her students...awesome class
Should be compulsory to take this class, it rocks!!

Literally, the kindest professor I have had at SFU. He truly cares for all of his students and I am happy I got to take the class with him. He is very receptive of class feedback and accessible/helpful outside of class. You will not regret having him as your professor. Tips: Do the readings he assigns and engage in class discussions. He's the GOAT
TA was bad, but the prof gave great and respected feedback on assignments. Clear grading criteria. Just small assignments throughout the semester. Recommend.

He is an amazing prof. Took him as a distance ed course so did not really get to know him too well. But he is super kind when it comes to him marking your papers, the TA was a bit rough. This course is mainly personal reflection so be ready to write, but it's really not too bad. Overall take this course with him if you get a chance to

**THIS IS NOT FOR EDUC100 BUT EDUC376**

Professor Montabello is an amazing and caring professor who gives great feedback and motivates you to dig deep and think about the implications of education. She gave lenient due dates because she knows how difficult life can be for students. She is also easily reachable outside of class time.
Susan is an amazing professor, she is super engaging, gives great feedback, the class material is structured on your preference, you need to attend class for a good grade, she does not use canvas.
He is the BEST lecturer in my student career life, so nice and kind; JUST CHOOSE HIM PLEASE!!!!!!!

Class was easy and Daniel was nice but the topics taught in the class were politically charged and highly skewed. The topics made me, as a student, feel forced to adopt an ideology and write my paper in using a certain ideology that I wasn't comfortable with, in order to satisfy what I believed the professor wanted to hear to get a good mark.

Daniel is a fantastic professor, he made an elective a very interesting class and expressed compassion when I experienced difficulties throughout the semester. As long as you give each assignment a good effort, you will do well, marks were generally very high.
THE BEST PROF AT SFU!!! He is very caring and understanding of his students. I highly recommend taking courses with him. God Bliss You, Dr. Chang!

Professor Daniel is amazing. He replies to emails promptly, gives great feedback, and truly cares about what he teaches. He will tell you what he expects, and he does it in a very caring and polite manner. A real legend during my short stint in the faculty of education. Helped me with my writing and critical thinking tremendously.

Awesome prof I love this man! Truly cares for his students and accessible outside of class (will get back to your emails quickly).You can tell he has a passion for what he teaches which is rare. Course was easy but interesting AND a GPA boost. 4 online discussions, 4 reading responses and a reflection paper. Seems like a lot but trust me, it's not.
